section.title: lms.djangoapps.mobile_api.course_info.constants module
section.paragraph: Common constants for the course_info API.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.mobile_api.course_info.models module
section.paragraph: A models.py is required to make this an app (until we move to Django 1.7)

desc_content.paragraph: Get info whether a user should be able to view course material.
Returns expiration date for a course audit expiration, if any or null
Determine if the learner has access to the course, otherwise show error message.
Check whether or not a course has unmet prerequisites.
Determine whether a user has staff access to this course.
Determine if the course is open to a learner (course has started or user has early beta access).
Serializer for Course enrollment and overview details.
Retrieve course enrollment details of the course.
Serializer for additional course fields that should be returned in BlocksInfoInCourseView.
Retrieve course modes associated with the course.
Gets course progress calculated by course completed assignments.
Return course images in the correct format.
Serializer for the CourseEnrollment object used in the BlocksInfoInCourseView.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.mobile_api.course_info.utils module
section.paragraph: Common utility methods for Course info apis.

desc_content.paragraph: Return the information about the users certificate in the course.

list_item.paragraph: request (Request) The request object.
user (User) The user object.
course_id (str) The identifier of the course.

field_body.paragraph: A dict containing information about location of the users certificate or an empty dictionary, if there is no certificate.

block_quote.paragraph: This API endpoint is specifically optimized for the course homepage on Mobile Apps. The endpoint returns the blocks in the course according to the requesting users access level. Additionally, response encompasses info fields with information about the course, including certificate URL, media dictionary with course image URLs, start and end dates for the course.
This api works with all versions {api_version}, you can use: v0.5, v1, v2 or v3
GET /api/mobile/{api_version}/course_info/blocks/?course_id=<course_id> GET /api/mobile/{api_version}/course_info/blocks/?course_id=<course_id>
&username=anjali &depth=all &requested_fields=graded,format,student_view_multi_device,lti_url &block_counts=video &student_view_data=video &block_types_filter=problem,html

definition_list_item.term: username (str): The username of the specified user for whom the course data
depth (integer, str, None): Optional number of blocks you receive in response

definition.paragraph: course nesting depth, you can get only sections, sections and subsections, or provide string all to receive all blocks of the course.

definition_list_item.term: requested_field (list): Optional list of names of additional fields to return for each block.

definition.paragraph: Supported fields can be found in transformers.SUPPORTED_FIELDS.

definition_list_item.term: block_counts (list): Optional list of names of block types for which an aggregated count
student_view_data (list): Optional list of names of block types for

definition.paragraph: video, discussion, html, chapter, sequential, vertical.

block_quote.paragraph: return_type (list, dict): Optional list or dictionary of blocks fields based on return_type.
Body consists of the following fields, you received this response if you use return_type=dict in query params:

definition_list_item.term: root: (str) The ID of the root node of the requested course block structure. blocks: (dict) A dictionary or list, based on the value of the

definition.paragraph: return_type parameter. Maps block usage IDs to a collection of information about each block. Each block contains the following fields.

block_quote.paragraph: id: (str) The Courses id (Course Run key) name: (str) The courses name number: (str) The courses number org: (str) The courses organisation start: (str) Date the course begins, in ISO 8601 notation start_display: (str) Readably formatted start of the course start_type: (str) Hint describing how start_display is set. One of:

list_item.paragraph: string: manually set by the course author
timestamp: generated from the start timestamp
empty: no start date is specified

block_quote.paragraph: end: (str) Date the course ends, in ISO 8601 notation media: (dict) An object that contains named media items. Included here:

list_item.paragraph: course_image: An image to show for the course. Represented as an object with the following fields:
uri: The location of the image

definition_list_item.term: certificate: (dict) Information about the users earned certificate in the course.

list_item.paragraph: uri: The location of the users certificate

block_quote.paragraph: is_self_paced: (bool) Indicates if the course is self paced
Body consists of the following fields, you received this response if you use return_type=list in query params:

id: (str) The Courses id (Course Run key) block_id: (str) The unique identifier for the block_id lms_web_url: (str) The URL to the navigational container of the xBlock on the web. legacy_web_url: (str) Like lms_web_url, but always directs to
the Legacy frontend experience.

definition_list_item.term: student_view_url: (str) The URL to retrieve the HTML rendering
type: (str): The type of block. Possible values the names of any

definition.paragraph: XBlock type in the system, including custom blocks. Examples are course, chapter, sequential, vertical, html, problem, video, and discussion.

block_quote.paragraph: display_name: (str) The display name of the block. course_progress: (dict) Contains information about how many assignments are in the course
and how many assignments the student has completed. Included here:

list_item.paragraph: total_assignments_count: (int) Total courses assignments count.
assignments_completed: (int) Assignments witch the student has completed.
200 on success with above fields.
400 if an invalid parameter was sent or the username was not provided
401 unauthorized, the provided access token has expired and is no longer valid for an authenticated request.
403 if a user who does not have permission to masquerade as another user specifies a username other than their own.
404 if the course is not available or cannot be seen.

desc_content.paragraph: Return a user for whom the course blocks are fetched.

list_item.paragraph: user current user from request.
username string with username.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns: A user object or None.
REST API endpoint for listing all the blocks information in the course and information about the course considering user access and roles.
API that returns course details for logged-in user in the given course

block_quote.paragraph: This api works with all versions {api_version}, you can use: v0.5, v1, v2 or v3
GET /api/mobile/{api_version}/course_info/{course_id}/enrollment_details

desc_content.paragraph: Returns user enrollment and course details.
API that allows the mobile_apps to record activity for course goals to the user activity table

block_quote.paragraph: Get the HTML for course handouts.
GET /api/mobile/v0.5/course_info/{course_id}/handouts
If the request is successful, the request returns an HTTP 200 OK response along with the following value.

list_item.paragraph: handouts_html: The HTML for course handouts.

block_quote.paragraph: Get the content for course updates.
GET /api/mobile/v0.5/course_info/{course_id}/updates
If the request is successful, the request returns an HTTP 200 OK response along with an array of course updates. Each course update contains the following values.

list_item.paragraph: content: The content, as an HTML string, of the course update.
date: The date of the course update.
id: The unique identifier of the update.
status: Whether the update is visible or not.

desc_content.paragraph: Updates a piece of html content with the filter functions stored in its module system, then replaces any static urls with absolute urls.

list_item.paragraph: content The html content to which to apply the content wrappers generated for this module system.
block The block containing a reference to the module system which contains functions to apply to the
include (content. These functions) Replacing static urlsReplacing course urlsReplacing jump to id urls
request The request, used to replace static URLs with absolute URLs.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns: A piece of html content containing the original content updated by each wrapper.
